qas.question: What percentage of Detroit's residents where white in 1940?
Where did the population of Detroit shift to in the second half of the 20th century?
How many blacks lived in Detroit in 1930?
What was the movement of blacks to northern cities called?
What industry is responsible for a large growth in Detroit's population?

context: The city's population increased more than sixfold during the first half of the 20th century, fed largely by an influx of European, Middle Eastern (Lebanese, Assyrian/Chaldean), and Southern migrants to work in the burgeoning <a4_0>automobile<a4_0/> industry. In 1940, Whites were <a0_0>90.4<a0_0/>% of the city's population. Since 1950 the city has seen a major shift in its population to the <a1_0>suburbs<a1_0/>. In 1910, fewer than 6,000 blacks called the city home; in 1930 more than <a2_0>120,000<a2_0/> blacks lived in Detroit. The thousands of African Americans who came to Detroit were part of the <a3_0>Great Migration<a3_0/> of the 20th century.
